section: A. Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor to provide certain services and resources (the "Deliverables") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
explanation: The Recitals section defines Recipient as engaging the 'Vendor'. However, throughout the rest of the document, the other party is referred to as the 'Provider.' This misalignment of terminology creates confusion as to which entity is providing the services. This is an in-text contradiction because the document uses two different terms to refer to the same entity without clear definition or indication that they are interchangeable.

section: 3.1 Termination of Agreement. This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The first sentence of Section 3.1 contains a structural flaw. It reads, "This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement..." The word 'Agreement' is unnecessarily repeated, rendering the sentence grammatically incorrect and unclear. This makes the text structurally flawed.

section: 5.1 Indemnification. Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Recipient and its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, successors, and permitted assigns (collectively, "Indemnified Party") against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including attorneys' fees, fees and the costs of enforcing any right to indemnification under this Agreement, and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers, incurred by Indemnified Party or awarded against Indemnified Party (collectively, "Losses"), relating to/arising out of or resulting from any claim of a third party or Recipient arising out of or occurring in connection with Provider's negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement. Provider shall not enter into any settlement without Recipient's or Indemnified Party's prior written consent.
explanation: Section 5.1 states that the Provider shall indemnify the Recipient against losses 'arising out of or resulting from any claim of a third party or Recipient...' This is a discrepancy. Indemnification typically applies to third-party claims, not claims made directly by the indemnitee (Recipient) against the indemnitor (Provider). Including claims made directly by the Recipient against the Provider broadens the scope of indemnification beyond what is typical and could lead to unintended consequences. It essentially means the Provider is indemnifying the Recipient for the Recipient's own claims against the provider, blurring the lines between a simple breach of contract and an indemnifiable event. This creates ambiguity and could lead to disputes over what constitutes an indemnifiable Loss.
